text.section:
Subject to § 21-207 of this subtitle, a fiduciary who breaches any of the responsibilities, obligations, or duties imposed on a fiduciary by this subtitle:
is personally liable to the several systems for any losses to the several systems resulting from a breach;
shall restore to the several systems any profits of the fiduciary made through use of assets of the several systems by the fiduciary; and
is subject to any equitable or remedial relief, including removal of the fiduciary, that a court considers appropriate.

A fiduciary is not liable with respect to a breach of fiduciary duty under this subtitle if the breach was committed:
before the fiduciary became a fiduciary; or
after the fiduciary ceased to be a fiduciary.
